title: Missiles & stratotankers: Satellite photos reveal massive US military build-up near Iran
content: Satellite imagery analysis reveals US forces at Qatar's al-Udeid air base have mounted Patriot missiles on mobile launchers, indicating heightened security concerns amid escalating tensions with Iran. This strategic repositioning allows for rapid deployment in response to potential attacks, alongside observed increases in aircraft and military equipment across the region.

title: T20 WC: Afghanistan push SA to brink, lose by inches in second Super Over
content: South Africa secured a dramatic victory over Afghanistan in a nail-biting Super Over contest. The match required two tie-breakers after regulation time ended level. Afghanistan fought hard, with Rahmanullah Gurbaz performing exceptionally. However, South Africa ultimately prevailed, advancing to the next stage of the tournament.

title: 'Family is hopeful': Rajpal Yadav‚Äôs bail hearing tomorrow
content: Rajpal Yadav, currently jailed in a cheque-bounce case, will have his bail hearing on February 12. His manager, Goldie, confirmed industry support from Salman Khan, Ajay Devgn, and Varun Dhawan. The family hopes for his release before his niece‚Äôs February 19 wedding, as FWICE also urged members to help.

title: Steve Smith back in action! Australia call up veteran as Marsh misses T20 WC opener
content: Australia faces a significant setback as captain Mitchell Marsh is ruled out of their T20 World Cup opener against Ireland due to a groin injury. Travis Head will lead the team in his absence. Veteran Steve Smith has been added as cover, ready to step in if needed. This absence impacts Australia's leadership and all-round strength at the tournament's start.

title: 'He's hale & hearty': Govt opposes Wangchuk's release on health grounds
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta made the submission before a bench of Justices Aravind Kumar and PB Varale in response to the Supreme Court‚Äôs earlier query, asking the authorities to consider Wangchuk‚Äôs release on medical grounds over his deteriorating health issue. SC had earlier directed authorities to conduct Wangchuk‚Äôs medical examination by a specialised doctor and file a report before it.

title: Salesforce CEO has 'angered' some employees at company Town Hall by making jokes about‚Ä¶
content: Salesforce employees are demanding CEO Marc Benioff publicly condemn ICE following his controversial jokes about the agency at a company event. An internal open letter urges Benioff to denounce ICE's "unconstitutional conduct" and prevent Salesforce's technology from being used for immigration enforcement. Employees are furious, citing past instances where Benioff's influence impacted policy.

title: FAA halts all flights at El Paso airport for 10 days citing ‚Äòspecial security reasons‚Äô
content: The FAA has imposed a 10-day flight restriction over El Paso International Airport and parts of southern New Mexico due to "special security reasons." All flights are grounded, with the federal government warning of potential deadly force against any aircraft violating the restricted airspace. Officials expressed surprise and lack of clear information regarding the unprecedented shutdown.

title: Google to employees: You can go for our Voluntary Exit plan, if you are not enjoying ‚Ä¶
content: Google is offering voluntary exit packages to its global business organization staff. This move signals a strong push for employees to fully embrace the company's AI-driven future. The offer targets those who may not be aligned with the rapid transformation. This is Google's third such plan in a year, aiming to streamline its workforce.

title: Salman Khan, Ajay Devgn and others show support for Rajpal Yadav after he surrenders to Tihar jail
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav surrendered to Tihar jail in a Rs 9 crore cheque bounce case. Following his emotional plea about financial struggles, several Bollywood personalities, including Salman Khan, Ajay Devgn, and Varun Dhawan, have stepped forward to help clear his debt. His manager expressed optimism for his release soon, with a bail hearing scheduled for tomorrow.

title: Bharat bandh on Feb 12: Banks, transport, offices - what will be open and what will shut
content: Over 10 trade and farmers' unions have called for a nationwide Bharat Bandh on February 12, protesting the Centre's 'anti-worker, anti-farmer and pro-corporate policies.' An estimated 30 crore workers are expected to participate, potentially impacting public banking, transport, and government sectors across over 600 districts.

title: ‚ÄòWe are Pak, we do things differently‚Äô: Salman Agha hails team‚Äôs bold approach
content: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha expressed confidence after their T20 World Cup win, stating the team's unique identity is their strength. He highlighted the improved middle-order batting and faith in their bowling attack to defend targets, even modest ones. Agha also noted the batting order's flexibility and the need for improvement in powerplay bowling.

title: 'Used Pakistan & threw us like toilet paper': Khawaja Asif's big remark on US
content: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif lambasted past alliances with Washington, stating Islamabad was "used like toilet paper" after serving US interests in Afghanistan. He described terrorism as "blowback" from dictators' past mistakes, lamenting Pakistan's failure to learn from history and its shifting allegiances for short-term gains. The remarks followed a deadly mosque bombing.

title: Mumbai shooting: Teen shot dead over 'love triangle', boyfriend, woman held
content: A 19-year-old woman, Shifa Sheikh, was tragically shot and killed in broad daylight in Govandi's Shivaji Nagar. Her boyfriend and another woman, reportedly infatuated with him, have been arrested. Police are investigating the motive and searching for the shooter, with no witnesses coming forward. The victim was found with critical bullet wounds to her head and neck.

title: ‚ÄòWhy only bowlers?‚Äô Ashwin defends Pakistan spinner as action debate explodes
content: Pakistan spinner Usman Tariq's unique bowling action has reignited debate after a match-winning performance on Tuesday. While critics question his technique, veteran Indian spinner Ravichandran Ashwin defended bowlers, highlighting perceived double standards in cricket's rules compared to batting. Tariq maintains his action is natural, having been cleared by the ICC previously.

title: Bank strike on Feb 12: Will banks remain open or closed tomorrow?
content: Bank unions across India have announced a nationwide strike on February 12, protesting the government's new Labour Codes.  Customers face uncertainty as major banks warn of potential operational disruptions, though they are making arrangements for smooth functioning. Unions also advocate for improved work-life balance and a five-day work week.

title: 'May not look like it but...': Ben Stokes undergoes surgery, shares pic
content: England Test captain Ben Stokes has successfully undergone surgery for a facial injury sustained during a nets session. The all-rounder shared images of his swollen face, humorously remarking on the cricket ball's condition. This procedure follows a challenging Ashes tour and comes as his captaincy is under review.

title: Trump‚Äôs zero tariff on B'desh textiles: Should India worry?
content: Since the European Union accounts for nearly two-thirds of Bangladesh‚Äôs garment exports and already provides unconditional duty-free access, the incentive to reorganise supply chains mainly to serve the US market remains limited.

title: General Naravane book row: Delhi Police issues notice to publisher
content: Delhi Police's Special Cell has issued a notice to Penguin Random House India regarding former Army chief General M M Naravane's memoir, 'Four Stars of Destiny'. The publisher clarified the book is not yet published, a stance endorsed by Naravane, amidst a political row over its citation by Rahul Gandhi.

title: ‚ÄòSC‚Äôs gender handbook too Harvard-oriented‚Äô: CJI says Chandrachud-era primer 'very technical'
content: Chief Justice Surya Kant criticized the Supreme Court's gender stereotype handbook as overly technical and inaccessible to common people and rape survivors. He emphasized the need for practical training for High Court judges on handling sexual assault cases. The bench set aside an insensitive Allahabad High Court ruling on an attempted rape case.

title: Adolescent love cannot be criminalised in the absence of exploitation: Delhi High Court
content: The Court observed that nothing was recorded to indicate force, coercion or inducement and medical evidence did not substantiate charges of sexual assault.

title: BMC: BJP‚Äôs Ritu Tawde assumes charge as Mumbai mayor, Sanjay Ghadi named her deputy
content: In a significant political shift, Mumbai has appointed Ritu Tawde from the BJP as its new Mayor, with Sanjay Ghadi from the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena stepping in as Deputy Mayor. This pivotal moment ends a near four-year period of administration rule after the BMC elections on January 15, 2026.

title: T20 World Cup: India‚Äôs strategic shift ahead of Pakistan clash
content: India's bowlers are intensifying their training to adapt to sluggish tournament pitches, particularly in Colombo. The team is also adjusting batting strategies, moving away from an all-out aggressive approach to incorporate more technique. This shift comes as they prepare for challenging conditions and a crucial match against Pakistan at the T20 World Cup.

title: Cabin crew supervisor accuses friend of sexual assault at Gurgaon hotel room
content: A cabin crew supervisor alleged her friend attempted to disrobe and outrage her modesty in a Gurgaon hotel. The woman had allowed him to share her room due to his financial constraints. A case has been registered under relevant sections of the BNS, and the accused is yet to be apprehended.

title: T20 World Cup: ICC got tangled in a controversy that wasn‚Äôt
content: The BCCI and BCB both erred in the Mustafizur Rahman IPL release dispute. BCB's "safety concern" pretext for avoiding India, fueled by social media, allowed PCB to create unnecessary drama. ICC chairman Jay Shah prioritised cricket, ensuring the tournament proceeded despite Bangladesh's absence, highlighting the distinct economic value of India-Pakistan matches.

title: Warriors trade rumors: Grizzlies guard could boost 2026 playoff push
content: Golden State Warriors are eyeing veteran guard Eric Gordon from the buyout market to bolster their bench for the playoffs. Gordon, recently waived by Memphis, offers proven perimeter shooting and playoff experience. His potential low-cost signing could provide crucial spacing and veteran presence alongside Stephen Curry, enhancing the team's offensive depth without disrupting the core rotation.

title: Spurs vs Lakers injury report: Who‚Äôs playing, out and questionable
content: The San Antonio Spurs, riding a four-game winning streak and holding a strong position in the Western Conference, visit the Los Angeles Lakers. The Lakers are significantly hampered by multiple key player injuries, including LeBron James and Luka Donƒçiƒá, impacting their depth and offensive capabilities. San Antonio, with a healthier roster, is favored to win.

title: Ayesha Curry steals spotlight with Stephen Curry at movie premiere
content: NBA star Stephen Curry and his wife Ayesha Curry recently graced the premiere of the animated film 'GOAT' in Los Angeles. Ayesha, who voices a character named Carol, shared photos with Stephen, who lends his voice to Lenny Williamson. The power couple's appearance at the star-studded event generated significant fan excitement and well wishes for their Hollywood venture.

title: Bhel shares plunge 6%! Why is it falling after Rs 4,422 cr OFS opens for subscription?
content: BHEL shares dipped as the government launched an Offer for Sale, aiming to divest up to 5% stake and raise approximately Rs 4,422 crore. The floor price is set at Rs 254 per share. This move follows BHEL's impressive Q3 results, which saw a 206% surge in net profit, driven by enhanced execution and revenue growth.

title: Stefon Diggs‚Äô ex steals Super Bowl spotlight amid Cardi B breakup rumors
content: Stefon Diggs‚Äô ex partner was spotted at Super Bowl LX cheering with their baby, drawing attention as rumors swirled about trouble between Diggs and Cardi B. Fans noticed Cardi left after the halftime show and later unfollowed Diggs on Instagram. The contrast between family support in the stands and online silence fueled intense breakup speculation.

title: SB LX, halftime show fall shy of ratings records
content: Seattle's 29-13 victory over New England in Super Bowl LX averaged 124.9 million viewers, while Bad Bunny's halftime show averaged 128.2 million, both falling short of setting records for most-watched U.S. broadcast and halftime show.

title: Wemby nets 40 in 26 mins, was keen to be 'greedy'
content: Victor Wembanyama watched the fourth quarter of Tuesday's game against the Lakers from the bench, wishing he could have kept piling up statistics after scoring 40 points in only 26 minutes of what would become a 136-108 Spurs victory.

title: LeBron sits out Lakers' loss, ending All-NBA streak
content: The Lakers were without LeBron James, Luka Doncic and Austin Reaves for Tuesday's game against the Spurs. For James, it was his 18th missed game this season, making him ineligible for postseason awards, thus ending his 21-season All-NBA streak.

title: U.S. hockey posts biggest Olympic win vs. Canada
content: Hannah Bilka scored twice to lead the United States women's hockey team to a dominating 5-0 victory over Canada on Tuesday at the Milan Cortina Olympics.

title: Quinn: QB Daniels could play more under center
content: Commanders coach Dan Quinn said the ability to unlock more from quarterback Jayden Daniels factored into the decision to change offensive coordinators after the season.

title: Montana LB Tuliaupupu granted 9th year by NCAA
content: Montana linebacker Solomon Tuliaupupu will return for the 2026 season after being granted a ninth year of eligibility by the NCAA.

title: Woman hurt by Olympian's cheating, declaration
content: The former girlfriend of biathlon athlete Sturla Holm Laegreid says it will be "hard to forgive" him for cheating on her -- and for making a public display of it after he won an Olympic medal.

content: Some conference championship rings fetch big bucks. Others wind up collecting dust on a closet shelf. Players share mixed opinions on the NFL's sparkly consolation prize.

content: There are no surefire free agent QBs available this March, and the draft class has only one first-round lock. So what now for teams that might need a quarterback?

content: It was a heartbreaking offseason for much of NASCAR, and as the garage descends on Daytona, the stock car world is ready to refocus on racing.

content: The Raiders hired Klint Kubiak. Here's what that means for Las Vegas, plus what's next in the offseason.

content: Drake Maye and the Patriots weren't able to do much in Super Bowl LX, but their future might still be bright.

content: Let's size up Seattle's defensive wrinkles, an explosive RB, great special teams and Sam Darnold's performance.

content: The QB isn't motivated to prove the haters wrong, but to prove people right. And on Sunday, he did just that.

title: NFL playoffs top moments: From Caleb Williams' miracle TD to the Super Bowl MVPÔªø
content: Here's a look at the wild and woolly NFL postseason, from frigid temperatures to trick plays and Super Bowl MVPs.

title: F1 testing LIVE: Max Verstappen fastest at lunch as Lewis Hamilton, Williams get on track in Bahrain
content: Formula 1's preseason kicks into overdrive with the first of two tests in Bahrain this week, and you can follow all the action live with ESPN.

title: Texas Rangers' promotional giveaways include bloodstained Nolan Ryan tribute jersey
content: On May 29, the Rangers will give away a jersey with a bloodstain imitating Ryan's iconic uniform from when he continued pitching after a ball split open his lip.

title: MLS jersey Power Rankings: Who's the best dressed in 2026?
content: All 30 MLS clubs have new jerseys for 2026, so who boasts the best (and worst) threads in the league? ESPN ranks them from first to worst.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Salah's agent in Al Ittihad talks as star open to Liverpool exit
content: Liverpool star Mohamed Salah has given his agent the green light to open talks with Saudi Pro League club Al Ittihad, Transfer Talk has the latest.

content: Tristan H. Cockcroft gives newcomers tips on how to best use the tools available to them in ESPN's fantasy baseball game.

title: Pickups: Collier, Mathurin, Clifford among top players to add
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: 'Godman' Killed 3 With Poison Laddoos In Car In Delhi, Promised Them Money
content: A self-styled godman who killed two men and a woman inside a car in Delhi Peeragarhi used a manipulative technique to carry out the crime, the police have said. He is suspected to be involved in seven more murder cases, the police said.

title: Woman's Half-Burnt Body Found In Suitcase On The Side Of Highway In Punjab
content: The half-burned body of a young woman was found inside a suitcase on the side of a highway in Punjab's Bathinda district on Wednesday.

title: 'Every Outburst Not Security Threat': Top Court Pulls Up Anti-Terror Agency
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday questioned the National Investigation Agency (NIA) over its decision to initiate a suo motu probe into the violence in West Bengal's Murshidabad district.

title: Parliament Budget Session LIVE Updates | Met Epstein As Part Of Peace Institute: Hardeep Puri Counters Rahul Gandhi
content: Parliament Budget Session LIVE Updates, Day 11: Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi spoke in the Lok Sabha on geopolitcal conflict, artificial intelligence and a challenge to the US.

title: 'Turned Into Traffickers': Elon Musk's Big Claim About Epstein Child Victims
content: A large number of child victims of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein were coerced into participating in trafficking activities once they reached adulthood, tech billionaire Elon Musk claimed on Tuesday.

title: British Woman Shot Dead By Father In Texas After Argument Over Trump, Guns
content: A 23-year-old woman was shot dead by her father at his home in Prosper, Texas, following a heated argument over US President Donald Trump and gun ownership.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Inside Pak-Bangladesh-ICC Standoff: How 2 Nations Bullied The Entire System
content: Pakistan knew full well that they were not going to get anything out of its tantrums. But there were crucial political points to be won - and they were.

title: US Slips To Lowest-Ever Rank In Global Corruption Index, Denmark Tops List Again
content: Anti-graft watchdog Transparency International (TI) warned Tuesday of worsening corruption in democracies worldwide and said the United States had slid to the lowest-ever score on its 2025 Corruption Perceptions Index.

title: Israeli Drone Strike Kills 2 Cyclists In Gaza As Death Count Mounts Despite Ceasefire
content: Two Palestinians on bicycles were killed in an Israeli drone strike on Tuesday, hospital officials said, marking the latest deaths since an October ceasefire that hasn't halted deadly attacks in the Gaza Strip.

title: BNP Wants Best Of Both Worlds - Hasina's Return And Good Ties With India
content: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) led by Tarique Rahman seems undecided about what kind of relationship to keep with neighbouring India.

title: "President Trump, Talk To Us As Equals": Rahul Gandhi's Dig At Centre
content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi today outlined what the Opposition bloc INDIA would say to US President Donald Trump on the latest trade deal.

title: "Rafale Was Hero During Op Sindoor": Vice Chief Of Air Staff
content: Vice Chief of the Air Staff Air Marshal Nagesh Kapoor on Wednesday said that Rafale fighter jets were the "hero" during Operation Sindoor, and that the Indian Air Force aims to induct more Multi-Role Fighter Aircraft (MRFA).

title: New York Model, Carved In A Basement, Goes On Display
content: A painstakingly detailed model of New York City will go on display this week after a US truck driver spent 21 years building it in his basement as an evening hobby.

title: Bangladesh's 'Red Maulana': The Life And Legacy Of Abdul Hamid Khan Bhashani
content: Abdul Hamid Khan Bhashani began his political journey in the 1920s when he got involved in the Khilafat and non-cooperation movements in Bengal.

title: The End Of Sheikh Hasina's Reign: July 2024 Bangladesh Uprising Revisited
content: Students in Bangladesh started protesting in early July 2024 and demanded reform in the job quota system that reserved more than half of government jobs.

title: London Counter Terrorism Police Investigate Stabbing Of Two Teenagers
content: London police said it arrested a 13-year-old on suspicion of attempted murder after he allegedly stabbed two other teenagers at a school, and that its counter terrorism unit was leading the investigation.

title: Akasa Air Co-Founder Praveen Iyer Resigns
content: Akasa Air's Co-founder and Chief Commercial Officer Praveen Iyer has resigned, marking the second high-level exit at the over three-year-old airline in four months.

title: Pak To US: A Look At 10 Deadliest School Shootings After 10 Killed In Canada Attack
content: At least 10 people, including the suspected gunman, were killed, and more than 25 others were wounded in a shooting at a secondary school and a nearby residence in the remote town of Tumbler Ridge in northeastern British Columbia, Canada.

title: Till Death Do Us Bark: Brazilian State Lets Pets Be Buried With Owners
content: In pet-mad Brazil, the state of Sao Paulo will allow animals to be buried in family graves starting Tuesday, with a law recognizing "the emotional bond" that exists between humans and their household critters.

title: Epstein Files Release Spark Wave Of Resignations From UK To US And Europe
content: Politicians, billionaires, business tycoons and diplomats: they were all in the newly released tranche of Jeffery Epstein files. The high and mighty of US, UK and Europe are under the scanner for hobnobbing with a known child sex offender.

title: Vigilance probe unearths lapses in construction of Punalur-Muvattupuzha Road
content: VACB cites serious irregularities in the construction of the State highway, particularly in the 30-km Konni-Plachery stretch

content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told a bench of justices Aravind Kumar and P.B. Varale that the grounds on which Sonam Wangchuk's detention order was passed continue, and it will not be possible to release him on health grounds

title: Raichur MP G. Kumar Naik flags concerns over surge in cotton import, seeks stronger policy support for domestic growers
content: G. Kumar Naik said the simultaneous fall in production and productivity indicated ‚Äòstructural stress‚Äô in the sector, and warned that policy inconsistency was undermining domestic farmers

title: Rajya Sabha member raises concern over social media impact on mental health of adolescents
content: In recent weeks, there have been instances of young students ending their lives, apparently due to ill-effects, including loneliness and isolation, triggered by excessive use of online platforms

content: Adani Enterprises Ltd had alleged that Ravi Nair published and disseminated a series of tweets containing false and defamatory statements intended to damage the reputation of AEL and the Adani Group

content: The largest-ever Brazilian delegation to India marks the culmination of the highest-level engagement between the two countries over the past few years ‚Äî in a challenging geopolitical scenario

content: Speaking at the inauguration of a four-day International Conference on Tamil Epigraphy organised by the Tamil Nadu State Department of Archaeology (TNSDA), Mr. Thennarasu said, unlike literary sources, inscriptions possess a unique authenticity

content: In a statement, State BJP chief Nainar Nagenthran said former Union Minister and party‚Äôs national executive committee member Pon. Radhakrishan will serve as the organiser of the committee

content: He blames the Congress for not having insisted on sharing power in 2006 when the DMK failed to get a simple majority

content: Jawaharlal Nehru International Stadium in Kaloor set to host Kerala Blasters‚Äô nine home matches between February 22 and May in ISL

title: Supreme Court verdict on forest evictions in Assam landmark, will streamline encroachment drives: Sarma
content: The top court said if an unauthorised occupation is found in a reserve forest area, the person shall be ordered an order to vacate in 15 days‚Äô notice

content: The CM was talking to reporters in response to a question about Ajit Pawar's nephew and MLA Rohit Pawar's claims and concerns regarding the plane crash.

title: Budget gives science missions big numbers but core funding gaps persist
content: The 2026-27 Union Budget sold science as an engine of growth but leading researchers in India saw familiar gaps; they said that while big-ticket missions and new funds look impressive, basic research, state universities, and core institutes still face stagnant support and uncertain disbursement

title: Workshop on stopping immoral trafficking for officers in Shivamogga
content: M.S. Santhosh, member-secretary of the District Legal Services Authority, has stated that human trafficking incidents occur for five major purposes: sexual exploitation, bonded labour, child labour or begging, and the forced removal of human organs

title: Boozer, Dybantsa, Peterson, Wilson on men's Wooden Award short list

title: UConn's Strong, Fudd headline women's Wooden Award top 20
content: the women's wooden award is given annually to the best college basketball player in the country . the top three scorers in the nation also feature in the list: Iowa State 's Audi Crooks (25.9 PPG), Vanderbilt's Mikayla Blakes and Notre Dame's Hannah Hidalgo .

title: See in photos how the Seahawks stopped the run and won the Super Bowl
content: The defense doesn't often take center stage in the NFL's championship game, but the  Seattle Seahawks ' unit took over in its  29-13 win  against the  New England Patriots  in Santa Clara, California Sunday night. The Patriots were scoreless in their 10 possessions of the game, tying the Colts (Super Bowl III) for the fourth-longest drought to begin a Super Bowl, according to Elias Sports Bureau. The Seahawks' defense held the Patriots to four first downs, 51 total yards, 2.0 yards per play and three sacks in the first half. We captured the plays that secured the Seahawks their second Super Bowl win.

title: Welcome to the offseason: What you need to know about key dates, biggest questions
